title: KMSG-LD
text:
KMSG-LD, <a href="virtual%20channel">virtual channel</a> 39 (<a href="ultra%20high%20frequency">UHF</a> <a href="digital%20terrestrial%20television">digital</a> channel 29), is a <a href="low-power%20broadcasting%23Television">low-powered</a> dual <a href="MyNetworkTV">MyNetworkTV</a>/<a href="Azteca%20America">Azteca America</a>-<a href="network%20affiliate">affiliated</a> <a href="television%20station">television station</a> <a href="city%20of%20license">licensed</a> to <a href="Fresno%2C%20California">Fresno, California</a>, United States. Owned by <a href="Cocola%20Broadcasting">Cocola Broadcasting</a>, it is <a href="sister%20station">sister</a> to <a href="Merced%2C%20California">Merced</a>-licensed <a href="Estrella%20TV">Estrella TV</a> affiliate <a href="KGMC%20%28TV%29">KGMC</a> (channel 43) and seven other low-power stations. KMSG-LD's transmitter is located on Bear Mountain, near <a href="Meadow%20Lakes%2C%20California">Meadow Lakes, California</a>.
KMSG's Azteca America feed is rebroadcast on KVVG-LD channel 54.1 in <a href="Visalia%2C%20California">Visalia</a>.
History.
KVVG-LD started out as KVVG-LP, an affiliate of Almavision for the Visalia area in early 2005. Formerly on channel 31, it later moved to channel 54. KVVG-LP changed to Tvida Vision in mid-2005. As of 2011, the station converted to a digital signal, as KVVG-LD.
The KVVG calls were originally used on a <a href="DuMont%20Television%20Network">DuMont</a> affiliate on channel 27 in <a href="Tulare%2C%20California">Tulare</a> in the 1950s. The KMSG calls were originally used on what is now <a href="The%20CW">CW</a> affiliate <a href="KFRE-TV">KFRE-TV</a> (channel 59) from its <a href="sign-on%20and%20sign-off">sign-on</a> from 1985 to 2001.
Until mid-2006, KMSG's programming was also seen on KPMC-LP (channel 42, now <a href="KZKC-LD">KZKC-LD</a>) in <a href="Bakersfield%2C%20California">Bakersfield</a>, which was sold to <a href="McGraw-Hill">McGraw-Hill</a>, becoming a standalone Azteca América affiliate and later a translator of <a href="American%20Broadcasting%20Company">ABC</a> affiliate <a href="KERO-TV">KERO-TV</a> (channel 23).
Programming.
KMSG provides programming for the Hispanic community. Some of its most popular programming includes <a href="telenovela">novelas</a>, <a href="sports">sports</a> events such as First Division Mexican League Soccer, <a href="news">news</a>, <a href="talk%20show">talk</a>, <a href="comedy">comedy</a>, <a href="reality%20television">reality</a>, and <a href="women%27s%20magazine">women's magazine</a>s.
Subchannels.
The station's digital signal is <a href="Multiplex%20%28TV%29">multiplexed</a>:
